main event: A radar operator observed an unidentified, very bright object in Ottawa, Ohio in 1959, which remained stationary and then disappeared abruptly. No visual observation was made.
interesting points: The object was described as 'very bright' and appeared larger than a normal aircraft target, remaining stationary throughout the observation.
The radar contact showed a magnitude of 0.2 and was probably an unidentified phenomenon.
The observed object was not accompanied by a visual sighting, raising questions about its nature and origin.
The witness was requested to fill out a technical information sheet, providing details about the sighting for research purposes.
The witness was asked to draw sketches and diagrams showing the path, shape, and details of the object.
